New Records: The Cavaliers are one win away from matching their best start in franchise history, which was 8-0 in 1976-77.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell scored 30 points, including a jumper with three-tenths of a second left to seal the win for the Cavaliers.
Damian Lillard had 41 points with nine assists and shot 10 of 15 from 3-point range, but the Bucks still lost.
Giannis Antetokounmpo had 34 points, 16 rebounds, and nine assists for the Bucks.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers were missing Caris LeVert due to a sore right knee, but still managed to win at less than full strength.
The Bucks played without Khris Middleton, who hasn't yet made his season debut as he recovers from surgery on his ankles.
Post-Match Reflections: Donovan Mitchell called the game-winning shot 'GAME' on Twitter.
The Cavaliers showed their gumption by winning at less than full strength one night after beating the Orlando Magic 120-109 at home.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cavaliers improved to 7-0 with the win, their best start in franchise history is 8-0 in 1976-77.
The Bucks have lost five straight since winning their opener.
Others: The teams meet again Monday in Cleveland.
Lillard's 10 3-pointers were his most since joining the Bucks last season.
Lillard's 41 points were two off his best total as a Buck.
